                <span class="visuallyhidden"></span>

        <div class="sm-12 lg-8">
            <div class="message-text A-TYP16R-RW-ALL"><p>HSBC will never ask customers to contact third-party insurance companies via SMS links or phone numbers. </div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Pay and Transfer
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region">

    
    


<h3 class="heading A-TYP16R-RW-ALL " id="content_main_heading_2">
    Request to reverse an incorrect transaction
</h3>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_2" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Before confirming a transfer or deposit of funds to a third party in Hong Kong, please verify the account number / mobile number / email address / FPS Identifier and partially-masked name (if available) of your payee carefully. In case any funds are deposited to a wrong account by mistake, please contact us for assistance as soon as possible. We will help you contact the payee to return the funds provided that all the necessary information is received by us. If the payee refuses to do so, you may consider reporting the case to the Police or seek independent legal advice to recover the funds, if necessary. On the other hand, if you have received any funds from an unknown source, please report the matter to us immediately.<br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_1" class="accordions-container sm-12">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_1" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="-371100504__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="-371100504__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Global payments </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-371100504__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_3">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_4" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_2">
    
    

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            General enquiries
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_3" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why can I transfer funds to my HSBC account in Canada via HSBC Global Transfers previously but now cannot?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">There are changes to our Global Transfers services. With effect from 17 Mar 2024, we will no longer support transferring funds via Global Transfers to your self-named HSBC account in Canada. After this date, you can still make transfers to Canada via other global payment services where charges might apply.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Due to this change, from 17 March 2024 to 16 April 2024 (both dates inclusive), the HKD50 local charge for self-named telegraphic transfer from HSBC HK personal banking account to account in HSBC Bank Canada via HSBC HK App or Online Banking will be waived. The charge waiver is only applicable to HSBC personal banking account holders with HSBC Global Private Banking status, HSBC Premier Elite, HSBC Premier and HSBC One customers. Please note other charges might be imposed by correspondent and / or payee banks.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please visit <a href="https://internationalservices.hsbc.com/international-banking/hsbc-canada-sale/#changes-to-payments-transfers?vid=019522f03d44000c5c33cad509bf0007b0042073007e8_hk&sid=1740047924548" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">https://internationalservices.hsbc.com/international-banking/hsbc-canada-sale/#changes-to-payments-transfers</span><span class="visuallyhidden">https://internationalservices.hsbc.com/international-banking/hsbc-canada-sale/#changes-to-payments-transfers  This link will open in a new window</span></a> for details.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why can I transfer funds to my HSBC account in France via HSBC Global Transfers previously but now cannot?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">There are changes to our Global Transfers services. With effect from 21 Dec 2023, we will no longer support transferring funds via Global Transfers to your self-named HSBC account in France. After the above-mentioned date, you can still transfer to France via other global payment journeys which charges might be imposed by correspondent and / or payee banks.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why can I transfer funds to some accounts in HSBC New Zealand via HSBC Global Transfers previously but now cannot?</strong><br></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">There are changes to our Global Transfers services. With effect from 30 Nov 2023, we will no longer support transferring funds via Global Transfers to your self-named or third-party HSBC account in New Zealand. Your relevant registered payee(s) will also be removed on the above-mentioned date. You will have to re-add them as new payee for other global payments in HSBC HK app or HSBC Online Banking. After the above-mentioned date, you can still transfer to New Zealand via other global payment journeys which charges might be imposed by correspondent and / or payee banks.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Do I need to update my beneficiary information for global payments to HSBC New Zealand account?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes.  Your relevant registered payee(s) to New Zealand will be removed with effect from 30 Nov 2023. You will have to re-add them as new payee for other global payments in HSBC HK app or HSBC Online Banking.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What are the cut-off times for global payments via telegraphic transfer on HSBC Online Banking and HSBC HK Mobile Banking App?</strong><br></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Transfer instructions are processed between 8.15am and 5.55pm, Monday to Friday, and 8.15am to 11.55am on Saturday, excluding Hong Kong public holidays.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can send transfer instructions whenever you like but requests received outside the times listed above are processed on the next business day.<br></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Applications for same day value are subject to cut-off times related to the time zone of the destination and/or the requirements of the settlement banks. This means that your account may be debited before the value day. We are not liable for any interest expense or loss incurred as a result.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is the cut-off time for telegraphic transfer in Renminbi?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">We process outward telegraphic transfer instructions in Renminbi from 8.15am to 4.00pm, Monday to Friday (excluding Hong Kong public holidays).</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can send us transfer instructions whenever you like but requests received outside these times are processed on the next business day.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Processing of outward telegraphic transfer instructions in Renminbi is subject to the schedule of the Renminbi clearing bank. For example, they will not process payments during holidays in mainland China, such as Labour Day and National Day.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What currencies can I use for telegraphic transfer? </strong><br></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Any currency supported by both the sending and receiving accounts.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>My overseas account is not a Premier, HSBC One or HSBC Advance account. Can I still use HSBC Global Transfers to move money from my overseas account to my Hong Kong one?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">It depends on the country or region your overseas account is located in. Please check the HSBC website or HSBC Online Banking page of the country or region your account is in for the details.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is HSBC Global Money Transfers?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">HSBC Global Money Transfers is a mobile-exclusive experience that allows you to make international payments to overseas accounts on the HSBC HK App. You can now enjoy a faster payment experience and save on overseas bank charges incurred by telegraphic transfer.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">See the <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/transfer-payments/international/global-money-transfer/gdlv-country-list.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">criteria for making Global Money Transfers</span><span class="visuallyhidden">criteria for making Global Money Transfers  This link will open in a new window</span></a></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Who can use Global Money Transfers?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can use Global Money Transfers as long as you hold a HSBC integrated or current or saving account and use HSBC HK App.</p>
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
 <li><a href="https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=hk.com.hsbc.hsbchkmobilebanking&hl=en_IN&gl=US" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">Download the HSBC HK App</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Download the HSBC HK App  This link will open in a new window</span></a></li>
</ul>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Haven't used mobile banking before? No problem, you can sign up using the app.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Follow the on-screen instructions to set up mobile banking and your PIN all at once. Once you're set up, you can start using Global Money Transfers.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I set up future dated and recurring Global Money Transfers?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Currently, we don’t support future dated and recurring Global Money Transfers.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I cancel or amend a Global Money Transfer payment?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can't cancel or amend a Global Money Transfer payment that has already been made. You must contact the bank or your relationship manager for assistance. Once we receive your request, we will send out the recall request on your behalf, but we can't guarantee the success of the recall, as it depends on the beneficiary bank.<br></p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_3">
    
    

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Fees, charges and exchange rates
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_4" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Do I need to pay a fee when making a transfer to an overseas account with telegraphic transfer?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">A local service charge will be applied to all global payments via outward telegraphic transfer. This fee is waived for HSBC Global Private Banking, HSBC Premier Elite and HSBC Premier customers doing transfers via HSBC Online Banking and HSBC HK Mobile Banking App to their own HSBC accounts overseas (including joint accounts).</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you request for any overseas handling charges to be paid by yourself rather than by the payee, an overseas service charge will be deducted from your account separately at a later date, once the charge has been charged back by the overseas banks. This can include charges levied by the payee's bank and any other banks used to send the transfer.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">We'll tell the overseas banks how you prefer to pay overseas charges. The final charge settlement will be subject to the practice adopted by the overseas banks.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="/fees/">See the latest Fees & Charges</a></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is the exchange rate for global payments after cut off times?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can quote the exchange rate at anytime. The exchange rate indicated by the bank only applies to immediate transfers. The exchange rates executed for future-dated transfers or transfers after cut off times (Monday to Friday 8:15am - 5:55pm, Saturday 8:15am - 11:55am, excluding public holidays) will be based on the exchange rate indicated by the bank on the day the instruction is effected.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you're quoting an exchange rate outside of the normal trading hours (Monday 7:00am HKT to Saturday 4:15am HKT during US daylight saving or 5:15am HKT during non-US daylight saving) or on Hong Kong public holidays, the rate provided will have a wider bid/ask difference.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>When are real-time rates available for Global Money Transfers?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Real-time rates are available from Monday at 09:30 until Saturday at 05:00 Hong Kong Time, excluding bank holidays. Exchange rates are subject to a higher bank spread during market closure.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I confirm my exchange rate for Global Money Transfers?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">HSBC real-time exchange rates are refreshed every 60 seconds. You'll be asked to confirm payment details including the exchange rate prior to proceeding with completing the transfer.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You'll be prompted with a message in a blue banner if the exchange rate has refreshed. Make sure you check the exchange rate before completing the transfer.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Which currencies don't have real-time exchange rates available for Global Money Transfers?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Real-time exchange rates are not available for the following currencies:</p>
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
 <li>BDT - Bangladeshi Taka</li>
 <li>BND - Brunei Dollar</li>
 <li>EGP - Egyptian Pound</li>
 <li>JOD - Jordanian Dinar</li>
 <li>KRW - Korean Won</li>
 <li>MOP - Macau Pataca</li>
 <li>MAD - Moroccan Dirham</li>
 <li>MMK - Burmese Kyat</li>
 <li>OMR - Omani Rial</li>
 <li>QAR - Qatari Riyal</li>
 <li>VND - Vietnamese Dong</li>
</ul>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The final debit amount and exchange rate will be decided after you confirm the payment.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What are the fees and charges for Global Money Transfers?</strong><br></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Fees and charges may differ depending on the payment details (such as destination country/region, transaction currency and amount etc.), please visit <a href="/fees/" target="_self">https://www.hsbc.com.hk/fees/</a> and download the Bank Tariff guide to see current Fees & Charges under section C2 for details.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can view all information related to fees during the payment process and before completing the transfer.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Note: Some banks may charge a fee for international transfers. Payees will need to check with their banks on what these charges are. The charges will be debited from the payee's account. We're unable to advise on the fees that other banks may charge for payments sent through Global Money Transfers.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_5" class="remove-bottom-space A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I ensure I get charged the lowest transfer fee for Global Money Transfer?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can check the information box at the end of your screen or before you confirm your payment to double check the charges required.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Depending on your payment details (such as destination country/region, transaction currency and amount etc), we will determine the suitable path for you, without bothering which rail to pick. Please refer to the criteria below for faster payment experience and save on overseas bank charges incurred by telegraphic transfer.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">See the <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/transfer-payments/international/global-money-transfer/gdlv-country-list.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">criteria for making Global Money Transfers</span><span class="visuallyhidden">criteria for making Global Money Transfers  This link will open in a new window</span></a>.</p>
</div></div>

            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_4">
    
    

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Making payments
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_6" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What information do I need to make global payments?<br> </strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Depending on the country/territory you are sending to, you'll need one or more of the following details:</p>
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
 <li>Bank code/sort code / local clearing code</li>
 <li>SWIFT code / BIC (Bank Identifier Code)</li>
 <li>IBAN (International Bank Account Number)</li>
 <li>Account number</li>
 <li>Payee account type</li>
 <li>Payee full name</li>
 <li>Payee address (optional in some cases)</li>
 <li>Purpose of payment</li>
</ul>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The usual way to obtain the bank details is to contact the payee directly and request the details from them.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why do I need to add a purpose of payment?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The recipient banks require information about what the funds being sent are for as part of the local regulation.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What currencies are supported for telegraphic transfers?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Send money via SWIFT in currencies including:</p>
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
 <li>Australian Dollar (AUD)</li>
 <li>Canadian Dollar (CAD)</li>
 <li>Swiss Franc (CHF)</li>
 <li>Renminbi (RMB)</li>
 <li>Euro (EUR)</li>
 <li>Pound Sterling (GBP)</li>
 <li>Hong Kong Dollar (HKD)</li>
 <li>Japanese Yen (JPY)</li>
 <li>New Zealand Dollar (NZD)</li>
 <li>Singapore Dollar (SGD)</li>
 <li>Thai Baht (THB)</li>
 <li>United States Dollar (USD)</li>
</ul>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">and others.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If your desired currency is not listed on HSBC HK Mobile Banking App, please proceed to HSBC Online Banking.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I send money with Global Money Transfers?</strong></p>
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL">
 <li>On your HSBC HK App, go to ‘Pay & Transfer’ and select 'Other global transfers'.</li>
 <li>Select who you want to send to, the country/region, payee account type and enter the amount.</li>
 <li>Select the 'Account to' and "Send from'.</li>
 <li>You'll also have to input your payee's account details such as their name, bank code (mostly in local clearing code format), account number and address (optional in some cases).</li>
</ol>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/transfer-payments/2023-Jan-GDLV-country-list.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">selected countries and currencies</span><span class="visuallyhidden">selected countries and currencies  This link will open in a new window</span></a>, you'll be eligible for faster global payments in a ‘Send like a local’ experience, while for other destinations outside our selected network, we will still route you through the telegraphic transfer via SWIFT network.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is authentication required when adding a new payee?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, you'll be asked to authenticate your identity using 6-digit PIN/Touch ID/Face ID depending on your mobile device and app settings.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How long do Global Money Transfers take?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Global Money Transfers usually take around 1-2 business day. Depending on your payment details (such as destination country/region, transaction currency and amount etc), the payment may arrive faster.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can check the estimated time for the transaction to be completed on the review screen, before you complete the payment. Once you've completed the payment, you can view this information again on the confirmation screen.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is there an option to add in additional details about the payment, such as invoice number?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, you can use the payment 'Reference' field.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I know which transactions are Global Money Transfer payments in my mobile transaction history?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">'Send like a local' transaction reference number starts with 'GXZ'.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Telegraphic transfer transaction reference number starts with 'N'.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_2" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    <div class="anchor" id="fps-faqs"></div>

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="-1681293236__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="true">
            <h3 id="-1681293236__tab0" class="dropdown-text expanded">FPS </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-1681293236__panel0" class="exp-content expanded" aria-hidden="false" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_4">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_5" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_5">
    
    

    <h4 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            General
    </h4>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_7" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is FPS? </strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">FPS (Faster Payment System) is a payment service platform that allows you to make instant payments to individuals and merchants. You can pay with FPS in Hong Kong dollar (HKD) or Renminbi (RMB) using HSBC HK App or HSBC Online Banking. It is available 24/7,free of charge*, covering participating local banks, financial institutes with Stored Value Facility (SVF) licenses. You can also top up your e-CNY wallet or pay designated Thai merchants instantly by scanning PromptPay QR codes.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Traditional fund transfers require the payee's bank account number, but FPS supports payments made using the payee's mobile number, email address, or FPS Identifier. FPS also enables you with a QR code to receive payments (registration of FPS and activation of Mobile Security Key is required to generate the QR code). You can also receive payments and transfers from institutions, corporates and the HKSAR government via your HKID number.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">*There is no charge from us if you pay money to, or receive money from accounts from other banks/ SVFs via FPS, but other banks/ SVFs may have different charging policies.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I use FPS on the HSBC HK App?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">On the logon page of the HSBC HK App, you can select "FPS transfer" at the bottom left to choose the following functions:<br></p>
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL">
 <li>Scan to pay: you can make payment by scanning a FPS QR code or a PromptPay QR code of designated Thai merchants</li>
 <li>Show QR code to receive: you can show your personal QR code after registering for FPS to someone so they can scan it to send you money</li>
 <li>Make a quick transfer: you can make payment with using the payee's mobile number, email address or FPS Identifier</li>
</ol>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">After you logon the HSBC HK App, you can go to the "Pay & Transfer" tab and select "Other local payees/ FPS" under "Transfer" to make payment using payee's account number, mobile number, email address, FPS Identifier or credit card number.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What are the benefits of using FPS?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">FPS is a simpler, quicker way to send money to people and merchants across participating local banks, and Stored Value Facilities (SVF) operators in Hong Kong, e-CNY wallet, and designated Thai merchants.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can pay merchants by scanning a QR code or make transfers to your friends just by entering their mobile number, email address or FPS Identifier. You can also have friends send money directly to your bank account as well as transfer money to HSBC and non-HSBC local credit cards to settle statement balance.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I use FPS when I am outside of Hong Kong?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can make FPS transactions to participating local banks and Stored Value Facilities (SVF) operators in Hong Kong and designated Thai merchants as well as top up your e-CNY wallet from anywhere in the world as long as you can log on to HSBC HK App or HSBC Online Banking.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I send or receive money from other payment service providers like Alipay? </strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, you can pay or receive money from other participating payment service providers via FPS.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_6">
    
    

    <h4 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Registration
    </h4>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_8" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Who is eligible for FPS?  </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">As long as you have an HSBC HKD or CNY bank account and have registered for online banking, you're eligible to register for FPS by linking your account to a valid mobile number, email address or FPS Identifier. To register for FPS with your HKID number, you'll have to have an account opened with us using your HKID as a document of identification.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How long does the FPS registration take to process? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Registration is almost instant. You will usually get immediate confirmation, but if you don't, try refreshing the page or going back to the FPS registration page.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How will I know if I have successfully registered for FPS? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You'll receive a text message confirmation if you've registered for FPS with your mobile number, or by email if you used your email address, FPS Identifier or HKID.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can also check your FPS registration status on the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app. Simply select your profile in the top right corner, go to 'Pay and transfer', then choose 'Register or view FPS registration'.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Alternatively, you can check it in online banking by going to 'Register or view FPS registrations'.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Will my FPS Identifier change if I deregister it and then register it again? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you deregister your FPS Identifier, you will receive a new FPS Identifier the next time you register. You will also be able to link the FPS Identifier to a different account if you wish.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If I am using a mobile number as a Proxy ID, does it have to be a Hong Kong number? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No, you can register with a foreign number. You will receive an SMS notification upon successful registration.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Do I need to include the country code when I am registering my mobile number? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Only if you are using an overseas number. If you are usi<span style="font-family: "HSBC Univers Next", "HSBC Neue Helvetica", "sans-serif"; font-size: 1rem; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; background-color: transparent;">ng a Hong Kong mobile number, the country code will be prefilled.</span></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If I update my mobile number or email address on FPS during registration, how long will it take for the changes to go into effect?  </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Any changes you make during FPS registration will be updated immediately, and your bank record will be updated accordingly. You will receive a notification to show that your information has changed.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>After registration, how do I update my mobile number or email address? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can update your contact details via the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app / HSBC Online Banking, by visiting our branch, by mail, or by calling our customer service hotline. Instructions on how to update can be found on our <a href="/mobile/faq/#cp">'Change contact details' page</a>.<br> <br> Once you have updated your contact details, your FPS registrations under your previous contact details will be deregistered. You will need to register for FPS again with your new mobile number / email address via online banking.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>To pay and receive money via FPS, do I need to link a bank account to a Proxy ID (mobile number, email address or FPS identifier)? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To receive money via a Proxy ID, you need to register for FPS by linking your Proxy ID to a bank account. To receive money to a bank account via FPS, no registration is required. Please advise your payer to choose HSBC (bank code 004) as the payee’s bank or receiving bank, then enter your 10- or 12-digit HSBC account number in the payee account number field. The first 3 digits of your HSBC account number is the branch code, followed by a 7- or 9-digit account number.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To send money to payees who have registered for FPS, you don’t have to be registered for FPS beforehand.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How many HSBC receiving accounts can I link to one Proxy ID? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can only link one HSBC account for each Proxy ID. However, you can use a different HSBC account for each separate Proxy ID. That means you could have one linked to your mobile number, one to your email address and one linked to an FPS Identifier.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I change which HSBC account I link to my Proxy ID? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, you can change it. To do it on the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app, go to 'Profile', find 'Pay and transfer' and select 'Register or view FPS registration'.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To change it in online banking, go to 'Register or view FPS registrations'.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>After FPS registration, can I change HSBC from my default receiving bank to non-default? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes. If you choose not to use HSBC as your default receiving account, your most recently registered account will become your new default. If you want to make HSBC your default account again, just check the box beside 'Set HSBC as a default bank when receiving money'. Please note that you can't undo this setting.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I deregister from FPS? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, you can deregister via Personal Internet Banking or the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why can't I see any buttons in the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app for FPS registration? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">FPS registration in the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app is only supported for iOS / iPadOS versions 12.2 or above, and Android OS versions 6.0 or above.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please update the operating system on your device and download the latest version of the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app, then try again.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Alternatively, you can register for FPS via online banking.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How to check the default receiving bank/ FPS participant of my Proxy ID?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can check your Proxy ID’s default receiving bank/ FPS participant on the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app. Simply select your profile in the top right corner, go to 'Pay and transfer‘ and choose 'Register or view FPS registration'. Then select the Proxy ID that you wish to check under the ‘Other FPS registrations’.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Alternatively, you can check it in HSBC Online Banking by going to ‘Register or view FPS registrations‘ under the ‘Pay & transfer’ menu, then select ‘View FPS registrations at other banks’ to check the default receiving bank/ FPS participant of your Proxy ID.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_7">
    
    

    <h4 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Transaction
    </h4>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_9" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I send and receive money using FPS? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Simply log on to the HSBC HK App, tap on 'Pay & Transfer' and then select 'Other local payees/FPS'.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To receive money via FPS using your Proxy ID (mobile number, email address, FPS Identifier) or personalised QR code, you'll need to first register for FPS via the app or HSBC Online Banking. You'll be able to easily receive money when people key in your Proxy ID or scan your QR code.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can also receive money to your bank account directly without registering for FPS. Tell your payer to choose HSBC (bank code 004) as the receiving bank, and then enter your 10- or 12-digit HSBC account number.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Note: The first 3 digits of your HSBC account number is the branch code, and the remaining 7 or 9 digits are your account number. </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What does the ‘Make a transfer’ function under 'FPS' on the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app let me do? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">This lets you make quick payments using FPS. It's faster than a normal transfer because it only supports payments to Proxy IDs. It also automatically takes the payment from your default debit account and sends it to your payee's default, so you don't have to make as many selections to complete the transaction.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For complete flexibility when making a transaction, including transferring via an account number, setting future-dated payments and adding recipients to 'My payees', you'll need to use the 'Transfer' feature under the main menu.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Does it incur any charges if I send money to another bank account via FPS? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">There is no charge from us if you pay money to, or receive money from accounts from other banks via FPS, but other banks may have different charging policies.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Does FPS support currency exchange? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For now, we only support domestic transfers of HKD to HKD or CNY to CNY via FPS. To use other currencies, you need to do a transfer via account number.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For payments to designated overseas merchants that support FPS, transfer of HKD to CNY or other currencies is supported.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is there a function where I can send someone a request to pay me? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">There is no specific function for requesting a payment, but you can ask someone to send you money by providing your Proxy ID or QR code. You may even embed a specific amount in your QR code when receiving money. Please remember that when you show a QR code to request payment, people might be able to see your mobile number or email address if you are using it as your Proxy ID. To keep this information confidential, you may use FPS Identifier as your Proxy ID instead.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I set up recurring transfers with FPS? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Unfortunately, recurring transfers cannot be set up using Proxy ID. However, you can set up a recurring transfer using your payee's bank account number via 'Other local payees/FPS'.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I add a new payee? Is it the same as before? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">It is mostly the same process, but instead of using the payee's account number, now you can use their mobile number, email address or FPS Identifier, as long as they have already registered with FPS.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I still use e-Transfer or Express Transfer for HKD and CNY transfers? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You will not see the options e-Transfer or Express Transfer anymore as most transfers will be done via FPS. However, if the payee's bank does not support FPS, we will still send the money via Express Transfer.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How long in advance can I set a future payment? Does the 45-day maximum still apply? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, it's the same as before: 45 days including holidays.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why was my payment to a registered payee rejected? It worked before. </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">As FPS transfers are instant, many banks may have imposed stricter controls in place to make sure the recipient's name and bank account number match. If you are transferring via account number and you've used a nickname to add this person to 'My payees', the payment will be rejected.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please ask your payee for the exact name the account is registered under. You'll then need to remove them from 'My payees' and add them again using their official name listed on their bank records.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please note that you don't need to do this if your payee has registered for FPS and you have saved them to 'My payees' using one of their Proxy IDs (mobile number, email address and FPS Identifier).</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why do I need to re-register someone to 'My payees'? I had no problem transferring money to them before FPS, and neither of us have even registered for FPS.</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">As FPS transfers are instant, many banks may have imposed stricter controls in place to make sure the recipient's name and bank account number match. If you are transferring via account number and you've used a nickname to add this person to 'My payees', the payment will be rejected.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please ask your payee for the exact name the account is registered under. You'll need to remove them from 'My payees' and then add them again using their official name listed on their bank records.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Someone tried to transfer money to me but HSBC rejected the payment. They successfully sent me money before, so why was it rejected this time? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Because FPS transfers are instant, we are putting stricter controls in place to make sure the recipient's name and bank account number match. If someone is transferring money to you via account number and they've used a nickname to register you in their system, the payment will be rejected.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To send money via your account number, this person will need to use the official name that your account is registered under. If you're unsure what that is, you can check your bank statement.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Alternatively, you can register for FPS to receive money via Proxy ID (mobile number, email address and/or FPS Identifier), so the person won't have to enter your name.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_8">
    
    

    <h4 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            QR Code Payment
    </h4>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_10" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What do the new 'Pay with FPS' and 'Show my FPS QR code' functions let me do? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The new 'Pay with FPS' button allows you to send money by scanning a QR code (even one from your photo album), or entering the other person's mobile number, email address or FPS Identifier. This feature will use money from your daily small-value payment limit.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">'Show my FPS QR code' brings up your personal QR code, which you can show someone so they can scan it to send you money.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is it safe to pay via QR code? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, it is generally safe to pay via QR code. When you use the 'Pay with FPS' function to scan a QR code, the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app will ask you to verify your transaction using biometric authentication or Mobile Security Key verification. These are unique to your device and cannot be used by anyone else.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Do I have to log on to use the 'Pay with FPS' or 'Show my FPS QR code' functions? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you have activated Mobile Security Key or biometric authentication, you can use the 'Pay with FPS' and 'Show my FPS QR code' functions before logging on. However, you will need to log on before making transactions or changing your settings. If you have not yet activated Mobile Security Key, 'Pay with FPS' or 'Show my FPS QR code' won't be available, but you can still perform small-value transactions after logon.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Will my QR code in 'Show my FPS QR code' change? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Your QR code will change when you change your Proxy ID, such as changing from using your email address to using your mobile number. It will also change when you embed a different payment amount or currency.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I just paid someone via their FPS QR code. Can I save them to 'My payees'?  </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Unfortunately, you will not be able to add them to 'My payees' after paying by QR code.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">However, you can use their Proxy ID (i.e. mobile number, email address, FPS identifier) or bank account to add them to 'My payees' via 'Other local payees/FPS' on the Pay & Transfer tab.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Does the QR code scanner in 'Pay with FPS' function work with non-FPS QR codes? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No. The QR code scanner in 'Pay with FPS' only works with FPS QR codes.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Does the QR code in 'Show my FPS QR code' function work with non-FPS QR code scanners? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No. Your QR code can only be scanned by mobile apps that support FPS.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I'm trying to scan a QR code to send money but it's not working. Why not? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please check with your payee to make sure their QR co<span style="font-family: "HSBC Univers Next", "HSBC Neue Helvetica", "sans-serif"; font-size: 1rem; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; background-color: transparent;">de is a valid FPS QR code and that it is up to date.</span></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I make a future-dated payment with QR code payment functions? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Unfortunately, the QR code payment function doesn't support future-dated payments. To set up future-dated payments, simply log on to the HSBC HK App, select 'Pay and Transfer' > 'Other local payees/ FPS'.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is the transfer limit for local payments using QR code?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can transfer up to HKD10,000 daily via QR code when sending money to family and friends.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For all merchants, you can transfer up to HKD10,000 daily when sending money to ecommerce, retail companies, and public utilities.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For <a href="/campaigns/fps/merchants/" target="_self">selected merchants</a>, you can transfer up to a limit of HKD400,000 daily via QR code, depending on your current non-registered account limit (for HSBC HK App/ Online Banking or across channels) and its remaining daily limit, whichever is lower.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can log on to HSBC Online Banking and visit ‘My banking’ > ‘Daily payment and transfer limits’ > ‘To non-registered accounts’ to check or adjust your daily limit for non-registered accounts.<br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_9">
    
    

    <h4 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            FPS x PromptPay QR payment
    </h4>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_11" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How does FPS x PromptPay QR payment work?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">FPS x Promptpay QR payment allows you to make instant payments to merchants in Thailand from your HKD bank account through HSBC HK App. It is available 24/7 and free of charge.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can open your HSBC HK App, select 'FPS transfer', then select 'Scan to pay' and scan the Thai merchant's QR code to make payment. We'll ask you to verify your payment details including exchange rate, and authorise the payment with your biometric authentication or your Mobile Security Key. If your payment is successful, we'll notify you via both SMS and email. You may also check with the merchant directly.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How is the exchange rate when I pay?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">This is an indicative live rate. The actual rate is subject to market fluctuation and will be verified before you confirm the payment.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Outside of normal trading hours (from Monday 7:00am to Saturday 4:15am HKT during US daylight saving time, or 5:15am HKT the rest of the year) and on Hong Kong public holidays, the exchange rate will be with a wider bid/ ask difference.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Which of the Thai merchants support FPS x PromptPay QR payment?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can use this service with Thai merchants that support PromptPay and the QR code is tagged to any of the following financial institutions (covering around 90% of PromptPay merchants):</p>
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
 <li>Bank of Ayudhya (also known as "Krungsri")</li>
 <li>Bangkok Bank</li>
 <li>Kasikornbank (also known as "KBank")</li>
 <li>Krungthai Bank</li>
 <li>Siam Commercial Bank (also known as "SCB")</li>
</ul>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why I cannot pay by FPS x PromptPay QR Payment by scanning the PromptPay QR code?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">FPS x PromptPay QR payment supports payments to Thai merchants of designated financial institutions only. If you encounter an error stating the QR code is invalid, it may be because the Thai merchant’s bank is not participating in this service or the QR code does not belong to a PromptPay merchant (for example, a PromptPay QR code is generated for payments to their personal bank account).</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Are there any payment limits for FPS x PromptPay QR payment?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes. Your daily small-value payment limit and daily cross-border transfer master limit are applicable to FPS x PromptPay QR payment. The maximum daily limit for small-value payments is HKD10,000 or equivalent. The maximum daily limit for daily cross-border transfer master limit is HKD3,000,000 or equivalent.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please visit <a href="/transfer-payments/limits/">HSBC Daily Transfer Limit | Payments and Transfers - HSBC HK</a> for more information.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I use the FPS x PromptPay QR payment to make payment from a non-HKD account?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No.  FPS x PromptPay QR payment only allows payment be made from a HKD bank account. You can view the exchange rate before confirming the payment.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I have a dispute with the merchant. What should I do? </strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In the case of a dispute, contact the Thai merchant directly.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I want a refund. What should I do? </strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Contact the merchant directly for refunds. Please note that the merchant will need to use alternative payment method (e.g. cash) if it is agreed to refund.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If I see the payment failure error message multiple times, what can I do?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In this case, please choose another payment method acceptable by the merchant.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_10">
    
    

    <h4 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            In-app Payment
    </h4>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_12" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How does FPS in-app payment work? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">FPS in-app payment in the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app lets you pay for your purchases with Faster Payment System (FPS) without having to leave your merchant's app. When prompted on the merchant's app, choose to pay by FPS. You can then select your HSBC HK Mobile Banking app from the payment options. You'll be asked to verify your payment details and authorise the payment with your biometric authentication or your Mobile Security Key password.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If your payment is successful, you'll receive an SMS and email notification from us. You'll also receive a confirmation from the merchant once your order goes through.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Who can use FPS in-app payment? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Use this function if you've:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>downloaded HSBC HK Mobile Banking app</li> 
 <li>activated your Mobile Security Key</li> 
 <li>chosen a selected debit account</li> 
 <li>set up a small-value payment limit</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you're an iOS user, make sure you've already enabled your biometric authentication on your device.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Which merchant apps accept FPS in-app payment through the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Any merchant app that supports FPS inbuilt app payment.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I place an order on one device and pay for it with the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app on a different device? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No, you need to place your order and pay for it with the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app using the same mobile device. For that, you need both the merchant's app and the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app installed on that device.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Are there any payment limits for FPS in-app payment with HSBC HK Mobile Banking app? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, your payments count towards your small-value payment limit, which is shared across other payment methods via HSBC HK Mobile Banking app or Personal Internet Banking website.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can view and change your limit in 'Small-value payment limit' under 'Settings' on the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How will I know if the FPS in-app payment goes through? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If your payment is successful, you'll receive an SMS and email notification from us. To confirm your order, check with the merchant via their app or contact them directly.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Quote your bill reference number if you need to raise an enquiry or resolve a dispute with the merchant. This reference number can be found in your transaction history via HSBC HK Mobile Banking app or Personal Internet Banking website. We don't handle disputes on our end.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I have a dispute with the merchant. What should I do? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In the case of a dispute, contact the merchant directly, quoting your bill reference number. You can find this reference number in your transaction history via HSBC HK Mobile Banking app or Personal Internet Banking website.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I want a refund. What should I do? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Contact the merchant directly for refunds. Have your bill reference number ready as you'll need to quote it. You can find the reference number in your transaction history via HSBC HK Mobile Banking app or Personal Internet Banking website. </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If I see the payment failure error message multiple times, what can I do? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In this case, please choose another payment method available from the merchant's app.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_11">
    
    

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Top up e-CNY wallet
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_13" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I top up my e-CNY wallet?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can now top up your e-CNY wallet through HSBC HK App with your HSBC Hong Kong dollar (HKD) and Renminbi (RMB) accounts.<br> </p> 
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Open your e-CNY wallet app</li> 
 <li>Select 'Top-up' on the e-CNY wallet account dashboard</li> 
 <li>Enter top-up amount</li> 
 <li>Select 'HSBC HK' from the payment option shown on your device</li> 
 <li>Authenticate HSBC HK App with your Mobile Security Key or biometrics</li> 
 <li>Select a debit account, verify and confirm the top-up transaction (exchange rate applies if HKD account is selected)</li> 
 <li>Go back to e-CNY wallet app and the top-up transaction is complete.</li> 
</ol> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I edit the e-CNY wallet top-up amount in HSBC HK App?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Top-up amount is non-editable in HSBC HK App. However, if you'd like to edit the top-up amount, you need to go back to the e-CNY wallet app, adjust the top-up amount first and then continue your top-up transaction with HSBC HK App.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I top up e-CNY wallet with my HSBC accounts in other currency ?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, you can top up e-CNY wallet with your Hong Kong dollar (HKD) and Renminbi (RMB) account(s) held with HSBC.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Are there any limits on e-CNY top up?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes. Your daily small-value payment limit and daily cross-border transfer master limit are applicable to e-CNY top-up transactions. The maximum daily limit for small-value payments is HKD10,000 or equivalent. For daily cross-border transfer master limit, the maximum daily limit is HKD3,000,000 or equivalent. Please note there may be other limit(s) applied by e-CNY wallet operator.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please visit <a href="/transfer-payments/limits/">HSBC Daily Transfer Limit | Payments and Transfers - HSBC HK</a> for more information.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I know if my e-CNY top up is successful?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If your e-CNY top-up transaction is successful, we'll send you a confirmation both by SMS and email. You should also receive a confirmation of the successful top-up from the e-CNY wallet or can check the balance on your e-CNY wallet app.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_12">
    
    

    <h4 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Quick Transfer
    </h4>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_14" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What's the difference between 'Quick Transfer' and 'Pay or transfer'? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">'Quick Transfer' is a feature found on the 'My accounts' dashboard in Online Banking. It allows you to transfer money between your own HSBC Hong Kong accounts and send small-value payments of Hong Kong dollars and Renminbi to people and businesses in Hong Kong.<br> Quick Transfer' supports payments via payee’s phone number or email address.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">'Pay or transfer' allows you to transfer larger amounts between your own accounts, as well as to people and businesses. With 'Pay or transfer' you can also send money internationally in Hong Kong dollars and other supported foreign currencies. You can also choose between immediate transfers, future dated payments or recurring payments.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">'Pay or transfer' supports payments via payee’s phone number, email address or FPS Identifier.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I enable the Quick Transfer function? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you've already set a default debit account and daily small-value payment limit, you won't need to set again. If you're a new user, you'll be guided through registering a default debit account and setting a daily small-value payment limit.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I use Quick Transfer to send money from a non-HKD or CNY account? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No. Quick Transfer only allows same-currency transactions, so you can send HKD to HKD accounts or CNY to CNY accounts. To transfer other currencies, you need to do the transaction via 'Pay or transfer'.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_13">
    
    

    <h4 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Autopay
    </h4>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_15" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How does FPS affect autopay? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you have previously set up autopay instructions, they will automatically carry over to FPS. You won't have to set them up again.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I want to set up a new autopay instruction but I can't find the company name in the list. </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Select ‘Others’ and then enter the merchant's bank account number or Proxy ID (mobile number, email address or FPS Identifier) to setup autopay for your bill.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I only need to enter a Proxy ID (mobile number, email address or FPS Identifier) to make payments with FPS. Can I also use a Proxy ID for autopay transactions? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If a merchant has registered for the FPS autopay function, you can use their Proxy ID to set up an autopay instruction. If the merchant hasn't registered for autopay – even if they are registered with FPS – you'll need the standard account information to set up an autopay instruction for them. If you are unsure, check with the merchant.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_14">
    
    

    <h4 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Payment Limit
    </h4>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_16" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How much money can I send to e-wallet using FPS? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The transfer limit depends on the top up limit of the particular e-wallet you are sending money to. Please refer to the policy of the e-wallet.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Where can I check my small-value payment limit? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can view and change your limit in 'Small-value payment limit' under 'Settings' on the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app, or in 'Daily payment and transfer limits' in Personal Internet Banking.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What happens if I make a payment that exceeds my small-value payment limit? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You'll be asked to authenticate the transaction using your Mobile Security Key / Security Device.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please note, you will not be able to proceed if you make a payment that exceeds your limit via 'Pay with FPS' on the HSBC HK App's log on page. To continue with your payment, please cancel the transaction, log on, go to 'Pay & Transfer' tab and select 'Other local payees/ FPS'.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_15">
    
    

    <h4 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Notification
    </h4>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_17" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>When I send money to someone, will I know if the transaction was successful? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If your transaction is successful, you will receive an SMS and email notification. The record will also show in your transaction history.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Will I be notified if someone sends money to my HSBC account? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, you will receive a notification. The record will also show in your transaction history.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>When I make a payment to someone at another bank, will they receive a notification? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">That depends on your payee's receiver. Some will send them a notification, but some will not.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_16">
    
    

    <h4 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Transaction History
    </h4>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_18" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Where can I check my FPS transaction history? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can see your FPS transaction history in your account details via HSBC HK Mobile Banking app or Personal Internet Banking. It will also appear on your bank statement, but some details such as message to recipient will not be shown.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What kind of information will the FPS transaction history display? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can view the details for both payments you send and receive, including messages to payees or bill references to merchants.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The names displayed have different formats depending on the transactions. If you were the payee, you will see the sender’s full name. If you’ve sent money to someone, you’ll see a masked version of their name while they’ll see your full name. If you’ve sent money to a merchant, then you’ll see the merchant’s full name.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_3" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    <div class="anchor" id="edda"></div>

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="-255043303__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="-255043303__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Top up HSBC accounts via eDDA </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-255043303__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_5">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_6" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_19" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is 'Top up HSBC accounts via eDDA' service?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">With this service, you can transfer funds in Hong Kong dollars or Renminbi directly, through HSBC Online or Mobile Banking, from your linked same-name accounts maintained at other selected local banks to your HSBC accounts.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">First, complete a one-time set up of an account top-up instruction to link your respective same-name accounts via eDDA.  You can then top up your HSBC accounts thereafter.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR14R-RW-ALL">Remark: eDDA means a direct debit authorisation set up by electronic means using HKICL FPS.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What currencies are supported by 'Top up HSBC accounts via eDDA' service?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">'Top up HSBC accounts via eDDA' service supports Hong Kong Dollar (HKD) and Renminbi (CNY) transfers.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Your HSBC account(s) and same-name account(s) maintained at other local banks must be of the same currency. No currency exchange is involved.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR14R-RW-ALL">Remark: Some debiting banks might not support both of the currencies. For details, please refer to the <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/transfer-payments/edda-bank-list.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">bank list</span><span class="visuallyhidden">bank list  This link will open in a new window</span></a>.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is the service hour for using 'Top up HSBC accounts via eDDA' service?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can use this service anytime through HSBC Online or Mobile Banking.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Which local banks can I choose when I set up instructions to top up my HSBC accounts via eDDA?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can view the available local bank list when you select the debiting bank ('From' / 'Transfer from' field) during set up.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/transfer-payments/edda-bank-list.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">View the latest bank list</span><span class="visuallyhidden">View the latest bank list  This link will open in a new window</span></a></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Are there any charges for using 'Top up HSBC accounts via eDDA' service?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Top up HSBC accounts via eDDA service is free of charge at HSBC. However, other banks may have different charging policies. Please contact the debiting bank regarding their charges. </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please also ensure that you have sufficient funds in the debiting bank account before submitting your top-up instruction at HSBC. You might be charged by the debiting bank if your top-up is unsuccessful due to insufficient funds in your account at the debiting bank.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Are there any transfer limits for 'Top up HSBC accounts via eDDA' service?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can top up your HSBC accounts up to the maximum daily transfer limit for each account top-up instruction linking to your same-name account maintained at other local banks.</p>
