<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can view the respective maximum daily transfer limit per instruction for a selected local bank (eg HKD/CNY10,000) when you set up an instruction or in the bank list, which may differ for different banks. For each set-up, you can set a desired daily transfer limit up to the maximum limit specified, which will later be shown and be in effect when you top up your HSBC accounts with that instruction.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In addition to the daily transfer limit for each account top-up instruction, there's a master daily transfer limit for fund-in transfer to HSBC accounts via eDDA (across all account top-up instructions) of HKD100,000 (or its CNY equivalent).</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Transfers may also be subject to the other banks' respective limits. </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What should I do if I want to amend my 'Top up HSBC accounts via eDDA' details after I set up an account top-up instruction?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can delete the set-up instruction via the 'Manage instructions' page on HSBC Online or Mobile Banking and set up another account top-up instruction to link your same-name accounts again via 'Set up instructions' page.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Will I receive any notification after submitting different instructions with 'Top up HSBC accounts via eDDA'?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You'll receive SMS and email notifications after submitting instructions to:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Set up new instructions to link your same-name account at other local bank to your HSBC account. We'll also send SMS and email notifications to you after receiving confirmation from the debiting bank</li> 
 <li>Submit top-up instruction to transfer funds to your HSBC accounts</li> 
 <li>Delete set-up instruction to cancel the link between your same-name account and your HSBC account</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I use 'Top up HSBC accounts via eDDA' service?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Read the step-by-step guide for <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/transfer-payments/edda-mbx-step-guide.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">HSBC HK App</span><span class="visuallyhidden">HSBC HK App  This link will open in a new window</span></a> or <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/transfer-payments/edda-pib-step-guide.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">HSBC Online Banking</span><span class="visuallyhidden">HSBC Online Banking  This link will open in a new window</span></a>.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_4" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="-1367861643__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="-1367861643__tab0" class="dropdown-text"> autoPay </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-1367861643__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_6">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_7" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_20" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I set up or manage an autoPay instruction?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Select ‘autoPay’ under ‘Pay & Transfer’ tab on HSBC HK App to set up a new autoPay instruction or manage existing ones.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is the lead-time for setting up autoPay instructions?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The lead-time depends on the arrangement with a particular merchant/organisation. You can also check this lead-time with the merchant/organisation in question.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I can't find my autoPay merchant or organisation in the dropdown menu. What should I do?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To set up an autoPay with a merchant/organisation that is not on list, select 'Other merchant/ organisation', then enter their bank account number or FPS proxy ID (ie mobile/ email/ FPS ID) and other merchant / organisation’s details.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<h3 class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL heading"><strong>What do the 'Edit autoPay instruction' and 'Delete autoPay instruction' buttons do under 'autoPay details'?</strong></h3> 
<h3>You can change an existing autoPay instruction by selecting 'Edit autoPay instruction'. To cancel an existing autoPay instruction, you can select 'Delete autoPay instruction'.</h3> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>When will my change to an autoPay instruction take effect?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Any change to an existing autoPay instruction will be submitted to the merchant/organisation within 2 working days. The effective date will depend on their process.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I change <payment arrangement/ payment frequency / number of payments allowed per frequency / amount / expiry date> for my autoPay?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can review and change your autoPay details in 3 simple steps:</p> 
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Select 'autoPay' under ‘Pay & Transfer’ tab on HSBC HK App</li> 
 <li>Select the autoPay record you want to edit under 'Manage autoPay'</li> 
 <li>Select 'Edit autoPay instruction'.</li> 
</ol> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is 'Number of payments allowed per frequency' in 'Manage autoPay'?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">This is the maximum number of payments you want to allow in a specified period. For example, one payment per week or three payments per month, etc. You can edit 'Number of payments allowed per frequency' by selecting 'Edit autoPay instruction' under 'Manage autoPay' page.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is ‘Maximum amount per payment’?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If your payment amount is likely to vary each time (for example, your electricity bill), please enter the maximum amount you would expect to pay in a single payment or select unlimited amount.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please note that if your bill is higher than your maximum amount, the autoPay instruction will be rejected and the payment will not go through.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is the difference between 'One-off' payment and 'Recurring payment' on the 'Manage autoPay' page, under 'Payment arrangement' field?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">'One-off payment' is a payment that will only happen once, so autoPay will cancel the instruction once it expires or the payment has been made, whichever comes first.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">'Recurring payment' is for payments that will happen on a regular basis, such as a monthly bill.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_5" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="1209026999__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="1209026999__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Standing instruction </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="1209026999__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_7">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_8" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_21" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is a standing instruction?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">When you make a standing instruction, you authorise the Bank to transfer funds on your behalf to another account, or to make a specific payment to a third party on a specified day at regular intervals.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What are the benefits of making a standing instruction?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">With a standing instruction you don't need to make repeated individual payments yourself.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is the difference between an autoPay instruction and a standing instruction?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">autoPay allows you to make payment regularly from an HSBC account to someone else.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">It is most commonly used for bill payments/regular payments.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">A standing instruction allows you to transfer funds for a fixed amount at regular intervals to other banks’ account.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I set up standing instruction via internet banking?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can set up standing instruction (i.e. recurring transfer) via HSBC HK Mobile Banking App (HSBC HK App) or HSBC Online Banking.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you’re using HSBC HK App, after you log on, tap on ‘Pay & Transfer’ on the bottom menu. On the 'Pay & Transfer' page, select ‘Other local payees / FPS’, and choose a ‘From account’. Choose a new or existing payee and on the transfer details page, toggle on 'Recurring transfer' option and input other details (eg. amount, start date, frequency, repeats), verify details and confirm.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you’re using HSBC Online Banking, after you log on, choose ‘Transfer to other local payees / FPS’, choose ‘From account’ and choose a new or existing payee, select ‘Yes’ in the 'Recurring transfer' radio button and input other details (eg. amount, start date, frequency, repeats), verify details and confirm.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I change the details of my existing standing instruction?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can set up a new standing instruction (i.e. recurring transfer) and delete the old standing instruction via the 'Manage future payments' on HSBC HK App or 'View / delete future dated payments' on HSBC Online Banking.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Alternatively, if you still want to amend the existing standing instruction, you can submit the changes using paper form, by visiting a branch, using the 'Chat with us' service in the HSBC HK App or by calling our customer support hotlines:</p>
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
 <li>HSBC Global Private Banking<br> <a href="tel:+852-2233-3033" class="no-link" role="presentation">(852) 2233 3033</a></li>
 <li>HSBC Premier Elite<br> <a href="tel:+852-2233-3033" class="no-link" role="presentation">(852) 2233 3033</a></li>
 <li>HSBC Premier<br> <a href="tel:+852-2233-3322" class="no-link" role="presentation">(852) 2233 3322</a></li>
 <li>Other customers<br> <a href="tel:+852-2233-3000" class="no-link" role="presentation">(852) 2233 3000</a></li>
</ul>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why was my standing instruction payment rejected? It worked before.</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">We're now using FPS to process your standing instruction payment to other local banks/ FPS participants. Many banks/ FPS participants may have imposed stricter controls to make sure the payee's name and bank account number match. If you are not using the official name that the payee account is registered under to set up the standing instruction, the payment may be rejected.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please ask for your payee for the exact name the account is registered under. You'll need to delete the old standing instruction via the 'Manage future payments' on HSBC HK App or 'View / delete future dated payments' on HSBC Online Banking and set up a new standing instruction using payees' official name listed in their bank records.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>For standing instruction payment (i.e. recurring transfer), when will it be executed and when the information on 'Manage future payments' on HSBC HK App or 'View / delete future dated payments' on HSBC Online Banking being updated?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Standing instruction payment will be executed on the payment date. However, for the ‘Next payment date’ and ‘Successful payments’/ ‘Number of transfers processed’ as shown on 'Manage future payments' on HSBC HK App or 'View / delete future dated payments' on HSBC Online Banking, it will start refreshing after cut-off time in previous business date. You may check the account transaction history on the payment date to ensure the standing instruction payment is successful.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the standing instruction payment is unsuccessful, you will receive notification accordingly.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_6" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="-1620759791__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h4 id="-1620759791__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Payee and limit </h4>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-1620759791__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_8">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_9" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_22" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is 'daily cross-border transfer master limit' to be effective from 30 June 2024?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To better protect your HSBC accounts against fraudulent activities, with effect from 30 June 2024, we're implementing a ‘daily cross-border transfer master limit’. This is a daily master limit of up to HKD3,000,000 or equivalent, covering all global payments / transfers (except Great Bay Area Wealth Management Connect transfers) to registered/ non-registered global accounts, and self-named/ third-party global HSBC accounts via HSBC HK App and Online Banking. Global payments/ transfers before the effective date would not be impacted.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What will be the impact to my global payments/ transfers after the launch of ‘daily cross-border transfer master limit’?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The daily cross-border transfer master limit will be effective from 30 June 2024, set at HKD0 by default as a precaution to protect your accounts. Please change your daily master limit based on your transaction needs to continue using our global payments/ transfers services<sup><a href="#fn-transfer-and-payment-payeelimit-gbawmc" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">1</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 1</span></a></sup>, including:<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Global payments/ transfers services via HSBC HK App<br> </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Your global HSBC accounts</li> 
 <li>Other global transfers</li> 
 <li>FPS x PromptPay QR payment via 'Scan to pay'</li> 
 <li>Top-up e-CNY wallet via HSBC HK App<br> </li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Global payments/ transfers services via HSBC Online Banking<br> </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>HSBC Global Transfers to your HSBC accounts</li> 
 <li>HSBC Global Transfers to other HSBC accounts</li> 
 <li>Global payments to other accounts</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I set / adjust the 'daily cross-border transfer master limit' on or after 30 June 2024?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please ensure that you've activated your Mobile Security Key (or hold a physical security device) and maintained a valid email address and mobile number in your bank record before setting your daily cross-border transfer master limit.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Via HSBC HK App:<br> </p> 
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Log on and select 'Pay & Transfer' at the bottom</li> 
 <li>Tap on 'Set limits' icon under 'More actions'; or select the profile icon on top right corner, then select 'Pay and Transfer' under 'Settings and preferences'</li> 
 <li>Select 'Daily cross-border transfer master limit' under 'Transfer and withdrawal limits'</li> 
 <li>Follow the instructions to set your daily cross-border transfer master limit</li> 
</ol> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Note: Please ensure you have the latest version of the HSBC HK App.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><br> Via HSBC Online Banking:<br> </p> 
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Log on and go to 'Settings' under 'Pay & transfer' from the top menu, then select 'Daily payment and transfer limits'</li> 
 <li>Choose 'Edit' next to ‘Global payments and transfers'</li> 
 <li>Follow the instructions to set your daily cross-border transfer master limit</li> 
</ol> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>When will the registered payee become effective?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The new payee you've added will become effective on the next working day when submitted within business hours in HKT (before 9:00pm from Monday to Friday, or 6:00pm on Saturday). Outside business hours, such as on public holidays, this can take up to 2 working days.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Will I receive confirmation once the payee is added successfully?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Once you've successfully submitted an instruction for adding a new payee, we'll notify you both via SMS and email.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>When I try to add a new payee, I get the error message "You've already added this payee to your payees list." Why? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You may have already added this payee. Please check 'My payees' list to confirm if the payee already exists. If yes, you don't need to add them again, and can make transfers to them directly.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Are there any limits on fund transfers?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes. We have daily limits for payments to registered and non-registered accounts, self-named<sup><a href="#fn-transfer-and-payment-payeelimit-thirdpartyhsbc" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">2</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 2</span></a></sup> and third-party HSBC accounts and bill payments, etc. made through digital and self-service channels, including HSBC HK App and Online Banking, phone banking and ATM services.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please visit <a href="/transfer-payments/limits/">HSBC Daily Transfer Limit | Payments and Transfers - HSBC HK</a> for details.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I change my daily transfer limits?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Using the transaction-signing capability along with Mobile Security Key (MSK) and security device, you can update your payment and transfer limits<sup><a href="#fn-transfer-and-payment-payeelimit-updatelimitedda" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">3</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 3</span></a></sup> via HSBC HK App or HSBC Online Banking:<br> </p> 
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Log on to HSBC HK App and select ‘Pay & Transfer’ at the bottom, then tab on ‘Set limits’ icon; or log on to HSBC Online Banking and select ‘Pay & Transfer’ from the top menu, then select ‘Daily payment and transfer limits’ under ‘Settings’.</li> 
 <li>Select your preferred limit for change, then enter limit amount to set your limit.</li> 
 <li>Follow the instructions to complete authentication and update your limit.</li> 
 <li>For limit increase, we'll send you a confirmation via SMS and email.</li> 
</ol> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please visit <a href="/transfer-payments/limits/">HSBC Daily Transfer Limit | Payments and Transfers - HSBC HK</a> for more information.<br>  </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_23" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Are there any limits on money transfers between accounts encoded on the SAME account card ?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">These are considered transfers between your own accounts and so there are no limits. However, a transfer to one of your accounts that is not encoded on your account card (for both debit and credit cards) would be considered a transfer to a non-registered account and subject to limits.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I register accounts for fund transfers? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You'll need your Security Device or Mobile Security Key to set up a new payee.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Next, log on to the HSBC Mobile Banking app. Go to the menu at the bottom of the screen, and select 'Pay & Transfer'. Choose 'Add a new payee', then fill in the payee details.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I change my transfer limits for registered payees?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To increase or lower your transfer limits for registered payees, log on to HSBC Online Banking and visit 'Pay & transfer' from the top menu > 'Settings' > 'Daily payment and transfer limits'. Please note that to increase your limit, you will need to use your Mobile Security Key or Security Device.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I add the current account (i.e. with account suffix 001) of HSBC Integrated account as my registered payee?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To add a HSBC Integrated account as a registered payee, you need to first add the All-in-One integrated account number (with account suffix 833 or 838 or 888) as payee. When you made the local or global payments via HSBC Online and Mobile banking, you could retrieve that All-in-One integrated account from your payee list, and choose the specific account you want to make payment to (e.g. account suffix 001 referred as current account).</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_7" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="-877859745__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="-877859745__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other Pay and Transfer FAQs </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-877859745__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_9">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_10" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_24" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I make fund transfers to anyone I choose?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, as long as you know the full bank account details of the person or company you want to send money to. You can transfer funds to HSBC accounts and to accounts held with other banks, both in Hong Kong and overseas. There are some restrictions on renminbi transfers to China however - find out about <a href="https://www.hsbc.com.hk/personal/renminbi-accounts-services.html">Renminbi Services</a>.<a href="/help/faq/accounts/#renminbi"></a></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">There are two fund transfer options available to you. To transfer larger amounts on a regular basis, register the destination account and use the registered transfer service. For smaller ad hoc transfers, use our non-registered service.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I make fund transfers in foreign currency?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes. You can make fund transfer in local or foreign currency involving currency exchange.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No matter transferring money to a local or an overseas account, you can select the currency you wish to transfer funds from the currency list when you place the transfer instructions.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I modify or delete a scheduled fund transfer?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You cannot modify scheduled fund transfer. Please go to "Pay & transfer > Manage payees / payments > View / delete future dated payments” page on Online Banking, find "⋮" symbol to the right of your instruction, then delete existing instruction and place a new one.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_25" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why do I get an error message saying that 'Message to Recipient/Recipient's Bank contains invalid character. Please re-enter.' when I click 'Go'?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You'll get this error if you enter characters that are not supported, such as '–' or '!', in the Message to Recipient/Recipient's Bank box. The message should only contain:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Numbers (e.g. 1,2,3)<br> </li> 
 <li>Letters (e.g. A, B, a, b)</li> 
 <li>The following special characters: ? : . , ( )</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>For fund transfer requests, what is the maximum number of characters allowed in the payee fields?</strong><br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-NTCTBL-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div class="table-wrapper c-999" data-accessibility-tick-icon-text="available" data-accessibility-cross-icon-text="not available" id="content_main_notice_table_1">
     <table width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" border="1">
<tbody><tr><th style="text-align: center;"><strong>Payee details</strong><br>
</th>
<th style="text-align: center;"><strong>Local transfer by FPS</strong><br>
</th>
<th style="text-align: center;"><strong>Local transfer by RTGS</strong><br>
</th>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align: center;" width="19%"><strong>Payee account number</strong><br>
</td>
<td style="text-align: center;" width="29%">34 digits<br>
</td>

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_26" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How long does it take to process local fund transfers?</strong><br></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Transfers within HSBC can be done instantly if you select today as the transfer date. In general, Hong Kong dollar/Renminbi transfers to other local banks can be done instantly. For transfers in Euros or US dollars, the cut-off time is 5:45pm on a business day* (ie Monday to Friday except Hong Kong public holidays).<br></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For all types of foreign currency transfers, requests received after the cut-off time will be processed on the next business day* or on the day you specified in your instructions.<br></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">* All local fund transfers will be processed as usual even Typhoon Signal No. 8 or above and/or Black Rainstorm Warning is issued by the Hong Kong Observatory, or “Extreme Conditions“ is announced by the HKSAR Government at any time of a business day.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How much does it cost to make transfers through HSBC Online Banking and HSBC HK Mobile Banking app?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Making Hong Kong dollar / Renminbi transfers to most of the banks in Hong Kong is free*.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For transfers to some Hong Kong banks, or overseas fund transfers, fees and charges may differ depending on the payment details (such as destination country/region, transaction currency and amount etc), please visit <a href="/fees/" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">http://www.hsbc.com.hk/fees/</span><span class="visuallyhidden">http://www.hsbc.com.hk/fees/  This link will open in a new window</span></a> and download the Bank Tariff guide to see current Fees & Charges under section C2 for details.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please note that payees banks and any other banks used to send the transfer (both local and overseas) may impose additional charges, you can contact them directly about their fees.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">*There is no charge from us if you pay money to, or receive money from accounts of other banks via FPS, but other banks may have different charging policies.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_27" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I make a Hong Kong dollar / renminbi transfer to a non-HSBC account?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">1) Log on to your internet banking and select ‘Pay or Transfer’ under ‘Move money’ in ‘My banking’.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">2) Choose which account you would like to transfer from and what type of transfer you want to make.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">3) Decide if you want to pay someone via their mobile number, email address, FPS identifier or account number.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(To pay by bank account number, choose a bank from the pull-down menu. Then enter the account number and account holder's name.)</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I make a Hong Kong dollar transfer to a registered account?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">By selecting the account holder's name and account number from the pull-down menu and then entering the transfer amount.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Will my account name appear on the recipient's account details?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Your account name will only appear on the recipient's account details if their account is within HSBC. However, it will not appear if the recipient's account is a HKD Passbook Savings account.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How far in advance can I schedule a transfer?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Anytime from 1 to 45 days.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What happens if I have set up a transfer for a future date, but on that date I don't have enough funds in my account to cover the transfer?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In this case, the transfer will not be made. We will inform you by email that we have been unable to make the transfer.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">We strongly recommend that you check your Personal Internet Banking email on the actual transfer day to confirm the status of your transfer request.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What should the payer put if I want to receive money via account number?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please advise your payer to choose HSBC (bank code 004) as the payee’s bank or receiving bank, then enter your 10- or 12-digit HSBC account number in the payee account number field. The first 3 digits of your HSBC account number is the branch code, followed by a 7- or 9-digit account number.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is the bank able to confirm the payee account number so my instruction is not rejected?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">We are unable to verify payee account information. Verification procedures adopted in different banks/countries may vary. For example for some banks, both account number and account name are used to verify inward remittances. Customer is advised to ensure the completeness and accuracy of payee account information provided. </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_8" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    <div class="anchor" id="anti-scam-alert"></div>

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="-2052930877__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="-2052930877__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Anti-Scam Alert </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-2052930877__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_10">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_11" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_28" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>When I transfer to my local payee using his/her FPS Proxy ID / account number, there is a reminder displayed saying that the payee account is related to a scam report. What does it mean?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">This is an anti-scam alert message and will be shown when the payee's FPS Proxy ID (mobile number/email/FPS identifier) / account number is listed as “High Risk” as per the scam prevention advice provided by the Hong Kong Police Force on Scameter. You are advised to verify the identity of the payee before making transactions. The anti-scam alert is generated based on information collected from scam reports and recorded in the Scameter of the Hong Kong Police Force. Please visit the webpage of Scameter (<a href="https://cyberdefender.hk/en-us/scameter/" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">https://cyberdefender.hk/en-us/scameter/</span><span class="visuallyhidden">https://cyberdefender.hk/en-us/scameter/  This link will open in a new window</span></a>) for more details. </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>When I see a reminder displayed saying that payee account is related to a scam report, how can I cancel the transfer instruction?  </strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can cancel the transfer instruction by the steps below:</p>
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL">
 <li>HSBC HK App:<br> a. select 'X' at the top of the page; or<br> b. select '...' at the top of the page and then 'Cancel this transfer'; or<br> c. select ‘Cancel transfer’ at the pop up window before confirming the payment</li>
 <li>HSBC Online Banking: select 'Cancel' in the bottom of the page</li>
</ol>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is the source of the anti-scam alert and how is my private information being protected?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The anti-scam alert is generated based on information collected from scam reports and recorded in the Scameter of the Hong Kong Police Force. Please visit the webpage of Scameter (<a href="https://cyberdefender.hk/en-us/scameter/" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">https://cyberdefender.hk/en-us/scameter/</span><span class="visuallyhidden">https://cyberdefender.hk/en-us/scameter/  This link will open in a new window</span></a>) for more details.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I confirm and accept the anti-scam alert message and make fund transfer to the FPS proxy ID / account number on the anti-scam alert?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, you can, but please be reminded that the transaction has high risk of fraud. You are advised to always verify the payment details (including the payee’s identity) of every single transaction before making payment.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If I confirm to the bank to proceed with a transfer with FPS proxy ID (i.e. mobile number / email address / FPS Identifier) / account number flagged as “High Risk” and subsequently realize being scammed, what should I do? </strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you suspect you have been scammed, you may visit a police station or the Hong Kong Police Force e-Report Centre (<a href="https://www.police.gov.hk/ppp_en" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">https://www.police.gov.hk/ppp_en</span><span class="visuallyhidden">https://www.police.gov.hk/ppp_en  This link will open in a new window</span></a> or <a href="https://www.police.gov.hk/ppp_tc" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">https://www.police.gov.hk/ppp_tc</span><span class="visuallyhidden">https://www.police.gov.hk/ppp_tc  This link will open in a new window</span></a>) to file a report. In tandem, please report the case to us.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If there is no anti-scam alert message relating to my local payee, does it guarantee it is safe to transfer to him / her?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No, it is not guaranteed. The anti-scam alert message will only be shown if the payee’s FPS proxy ID / account number is included in the scam reports provided by the Hong Kong Police Force from time to time. If there has not been any report to the Police against a particular FPS proxy ID / account number at the relevant time, the proxy ID / account number will not trigger an anti-scam alert.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You are advised to always verify the payment details (including the payee’s identity) of every single transaction before making payment.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How would I know if my payee’s mobile number / email address / FPS Identifier / account number is flagged for anti-scam alert?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can check Scameter (<a href="http://cyberdefender.hk/" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">cyberdefender.hk</span><span class="visuallyhidden">cyberdefender.hk  This link will open in a new window</span></a>) to see if it is flagged as “High Risk”. When performing fund transfer with use of FPS proxy ID (i.e. mobile number, email address, or FPS Identifier) / account number via internet banking or mobile banking app, we will display an anti-scam alert message for those FPS proxy IDs / account number flagged in the scam reports provided by the Hong Kong Police Force. You are advised not to make any transactions to the payee unless you have carefully verified the payee’s identity and ensure that the payee is trustworthy.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If a payee’s mobile number is flagged as “High Risk”, will his / her email address, FPS Identifier or account number also be flagged by the anti-scam alert?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">FPS proxy IDs and account number are flagged as "High Risk" in Scameter and triggered the anti-scam alert are based on information collected from scam reports provided by the Hong Kong Police Force. If there has not been any report to the Police against a particular FPS proxy ID / account number, it will not trigger the anti-scam alert.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I discovered my payee’s FPS proxy ID / account number has been flagged in Scameter. How come HSBC did not alert me when I now try to make payment to this FPS proxy ID / account number?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The anti-scam alert is generated based on information collected from scam reports provided by the Hong Kong Police Force and updated from time to time on a daily basis. Please check again that the payee is trustworthy before you proceed with the transaction.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I discovered my payee’s FPS proxy ID / account number has been flagged in Scameter. How come HSBC did not alert me when I previously made payment to this FPS proxy ID / account number?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">FPS proxy IDs and account number are flagged as "High Risk" in Scameter and triggered the anti-scam alert are based on information collected from scam reports provided by the Hong Kong Police Force. If there has not been any report to the Police against a particular FPS proxy ID / account number, it will not trigger the anti-scam alert.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If I find my local payee’s FPS proxy ID / account number is being flagged by the anti-scam alert, how can I remove it?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The anti-scam alert is generated based on information collected from scam reports and recorded in the Scameter of the Hong Kong Police Force. Please contact them at <a href="mailto:enquiry@cyberdefender.hk">enquiry@cyberdefender.hk</a> if you think the FPS proxy IDs / account number are not tagged correctly.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why do I found my FPS proxy ID / account number on the anti-scam alert when doing fund transfer? I did not commit any crime!</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">According to the record provided by the Hong Kong Police Force, your FPS proxy ID / account number is related to a scam report. Please contact them at <a href="mailto:enquiry@cyberdefender.hk">enquiry@cyberdefender.hk</a> if you think the FPS proxy ID / account number is not tagged correctly.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Will HSBC be able to help to remove my FPS proxy IDs / account number from the anti-scam alert?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No, we cannot do the deletion. The anti-scam alert is generated based on information collected from scam reports and recorded in the Scameter of the Hong Kong Police Force. Please contact them at <a href="mailto:enquiry@cyberdefender.hk">enquiry@cyberdefender.hk</a> if you think the FPS proxy IDs / account number are not tagged correctly.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If I want to report a suspicious FPS proxy ID / account number, what should I do?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The anti-scam alert is generated based on information collected from scam reports and recorded in the Scameter of the Hong Kong Police Force. If you suspect a crime case has occurred, please call “Anti-Scam Helpline 18222” hotline for assistance. If you suspect that you have fallen prey to a scam, please report to the Hong Kong Police Force at a police station or via Hong Kong Police Force e-Report Centre </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(<a href="https://www.police.gov.hk/ppp_en" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">https://www.police.gov.hk/ppp_en</span><span class="visuallyhidden">https://www.police.gov.hk/ppp_en  This link will open in a new window</span></a> or <a href="https://www.police.gov.hk/ppp_tc" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">https://www.police.gov.hk/ppp_tc</span><span class="visuallyhidden">https://www.police.gov.hk/ppp_tc  This link will open in a new window</span></a>)</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    

</div>
</div></div>

<div id="content_main_columnControl_11">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_12" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_17">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="ATM-chip-cards"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            ATM Chip Cards
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region">

    
    


<h3 class="heading A-TYP16R-RW-ALL " id="content_main_heading_3">
    <strong>Why does HSBC offer both UnionPay and PLUS network ATM chip cards?</strong>
</h3>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_29" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To give you more ATM network options when travelling abroad, apart from the current UnionPay ATM card, we have introduced an additional chip card that uses the PLUS network.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The charge for using another bank’s ATM overseas is HKD20 for your UnionPay card and HKD40 for your PLUS network card. These fees are subject to change. You can get the latest figures by reading our <a href="https://www.hsbc.com.hk/personal/fees-and-charges.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">bank tariff guide</span><span class="visuallyhidden">bank tariff guide  This link will open in a new window</span></a><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_3" class="accordions-container sm-12">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_9" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="-271617110__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="-271617110__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other ATM chip cards FAQs </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-271617110__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_12">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_13" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_30" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Who can apply for a PLUS ATM chip card?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you have an HSBC Integrated Account - such as HSBC Premier, HSBC One or our Personal Integrated Account - you can apply for a PLUS ATM chip card.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If I don't have an HSBC Integrated Account, can I apply for a PLUS ATM chip card?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To use the PLUS ATM chip card you must have an HSBC Integrated Account.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For details on the benefits of our integrated accounts or to open an account, call Customer Services on (<a href="tel:85222333000" class="no-link" role="presentation">852) 2233 3000</a> or visit any HSBC branch in Hong Kong.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why is my UnionPay ATM chip card linked to my savings account and the PLUS ATM chip card to my current account?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Some overseas ATMs can't access multiple accounts. They can only connect to the primary account listed on the front of your card.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To allow you to access both your Hong Kong dollar savings and Hong Kong dollar current accounts overseas, we use your Hong Kong dollar savings account as the primary account for your UnionPay ATM chip card and your Hong Kong dollar current account as the primary account for your PLUS ATM chip card.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To use the PLUS ATM chip card abroad you'll need to activate the overseas ATM withdrawal limit before your departure as the default overseas ATM withdrawal limit is zero. You will also need to maintain sufficient funds in your Hong Kong dollar current account<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I apply for a PLUS ATM chip card?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">At any HSBC branch in Hong Kong or send a completed enrolment form to PO Box 72677, Kowloon Central Post Office, Kowloon.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/accounts/personal-integrated/plus-atm-chip-card-enrolment-form.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">Download the PLUS ATM chip card enrolment form [PDF]</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Download the PLUS ATM chip card enrolment form [PDF]  This link will open in a new window</span></a>.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>When will I receive my new PLUS ATM chip card?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">We'll send your ATM PIN and card collection information within 5 working days of receiving your application.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>The UnionPay ATM chip card and PLUS ATM chip card look similar. How can I tell them apart?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can differentiate the two cards based on these features:</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-NTCTBL-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div class="table-wrapper c-999" data-accessibility-tick-icon-text="available" data-accessibility-cross-icon-text="not available" id="content_main_notice_table_3">
     <table width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" border="1">
<tbody><tr><th style="text-align: center;"><strong>Features</strong><br>
</th>
<th style="text-align: center;"><strong>UnionPay ATM chip card</strong><br>
</th>
<th style="text-align: center;"><strong>PLUS ATM chip card</strong><br>
</th>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align: center;">Account number<br>
</td>
<td style="text-align: center;">Integrated Hong Kong dollar savings account - the last 3 digits of the account number are 833 or 888.<br>
</td>
<td style="text-align: center;">Integrated Hong Kong dollar current account - the last 3 digits of the account number are 001.</td>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align: center;">ATM network logo (found on the right bottom corner of the back of your card) <br>
<br>
<br>
</td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><img src="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/images/faq-unionpay-logo.png"></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><img src="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/images/faq-plus-logo.png"></td>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align: center;">Signature panel<br>
</td>
<td style="text-align: center;">Signature required. Your signature will be verified by merchant for purchase transactions via UnionPay network.<br>
</td>
<td style="text-align: center;">No signature required as no purchase transaction via Visa network is supported.</td>
</tr></tbody></table>

</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_31" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>My child has a UnionPay ATM chip card through their HSBC Premier - Junior Pack account. Can they apply for a PLUS ATM chip card?<br>
</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">We now only issue PLUS ATM chip cards to HSBC Premier Junior Pack cardholders. Your child can continue to use their existing UnionPay ATM chip card until the card expires or you can switch to a PLUS ATM chip card now. The PLUS ATM chip card for Junior Pack has to be activated within three months upon card issue date. The existing UnionPay ATM chip card will be deactivated once you activate the new card.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To apply for the PLUS card, Junior Pack account holders can call HSBC Premier on <a href="tel:85222333322" class="no-link" role="presentation">(852) 2233 3322</a> or visit any HSBC branch.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What are the fees for withdrawing cash with my ATM card in Hong Kong and abroad?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The ATM cash withdrawal fees per transaction are as follows:</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-NTCTBL-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div class="table-wrapper c-999" data-accessibility-tick-icon-text="available" data-accessibility-cross-icon-text="not available" id="content_main_notice_table_4">
     <table width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" border="1">
<tbody><tr><th style="text-align: center;"> </th>
<th style="text-align: center;"><strong>PLUS card<br>
</strong></th>
<th style="text-align: center;"><strong>UnionPay card<br>
</strong></th>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align: center;">Overseas ATM cash withdrawal<br>
</td>
<td style="text-align: center;">HKD40<br>
</td>
<td style="text-align: center;">HKD20</td>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align: center;">Local cash withdrawal (HSBC ATM)<br>
</td>
<td style="text-align: center;">Free</td>
<td style="text-align: center;">Free</td>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align: center;">Local cash withdrawal (non-HSBC ATM)<br>
</td>
<td style="text-align: center;">HKD25</td>
<td style="text-align: center;">HKD15</td>
</tr></tbody></table>

</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_32" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">There is a difference in fee due to the usage of different networks.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Transaction fees change from time to time. You can get the latest figures by reading our <a href="https://www.hsbc.com.hk/personal/fees-and-charges.html">Bank Tariff Guide</a></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I keep using my UnionPay ATM chip card if I apply for a PLUS ATM chip card?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, you can continue to use your current UnionPay ATM chip card even after we've issued your PLUS ATM chip card.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If I have already linked my bank account to my Visa or MasterCard credit card, do I still need to apply for a PLUS ATM chip card?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">While some overseas PLUS network ATMs can access your bank account through your linked credit card, others will only be able to access your Visa or MasterCard credit card information. In that case, you would end up withdrawing cash from your credit card account and incur a cash advance fee. To enable you to operate both Hong Kong dollar savings and Hong Kong dollar current accounts overseas, the UnionPay ATM chip card is linked to your integrated Hong Kong dollar savings account while the PLUS ATM chip card is linked to your integrated Hong Kong dollar current account.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I could use my old magnetic stripe ATM card at PLUS and Cirrus network ATMs. Can I use these networks with my new UnionPay ATM chip card?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Your new UnionPay chip card can't be used on the PLUS/Cirrus network.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Your new ATM chip card can be used at:<br> </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>All HSBC ATMs, except those in Argentina, Brazil, France, Greece, Malta, Mexico, New Zealand and Turkey<br> </li> 
 <li>All Hang Seng ATMs</li> 
 <li>UnionPay ATM and POS network in Hong Kong, China and many other countries/regions with exception of some UnionPay ATMs that are in the process of upgrading</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you have any questions, please <a href="https://www.hsbc.com.hk/personal/contact-us.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">contact us</span><span class="visuallyhidden">contact us  This link will open in a new window</span></a>.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are travelling to a country/region where the UnionPay chip card is not supported, you may want to:<br> </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Prepare enough cash in the local currency before you travel<br> </li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Apply for an HSBC PLUS ATM chip card or link your Visa or MasterCard credit card to your HSBC account so you can access PLUS and Cirrus network ATMs abroad.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I link my Hong Kong dollar Visa or MasterCard to my HSBC account so I can use my credit card at overseas ATMs?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can link your HSBC issued credit card to your bank account by calling HSBC phone banking at <a href="tel:85222333000" class="no-link" role="presentation">(852) 2233 3000</a> or by visiting a HSBC branch in Hong Kong. If you apply by phone, the processing time of your request will be two working days. Branch applications take four working days to process.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Once processed, you'll need to activate the link by visiting an HSBC or Hang Seng ATM in Hong Kong and using your credit card to make a withdrawal, transfer or balance enquiry.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you don't have an ATM PIN for your credit card, you can apply for a new PIN at a branch or through Personal Internet Banking. If you have a phone banking PIN you can also request an ATM PIN by phone (Quick key: 5 then 3 then 3).<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">As a final step, you'll need to set an overseas ATM daily withdrawal limit for your credit card. You can do this through Personal Internet Banking, mobile banking, phone banking, at a branch or at an HSBC or Hang Seng ATM in Hong Kong.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I use my bank account-linked credit card at an overseas ATM?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can use a linked credit card to withdraw money from a PLUS or Cirrus network ATM overseas. In most countries/regions, the ATM will give you the option to access these accounts:<br> </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>credit card account<br> </li> 
 <li>checking account or current account</li> 
 <li>savings account</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the ATM you're using doesn't show these options, then any cash withdrawal you make will come from your credit card account. It will be treated as a cash advance and subject to a fee.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What makes chip cards more secure than magnetic stripe cards?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Chip cards include both a magnetic stripe and an embedded microchip. The data on the microchip is much more difficult to steal and use for unauthorised transactions when compared to a magnetic stripe.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">While chip cards help protect you from fraud you should still keep your card safe and protect your PIN at all times<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is the daily withdrawal limit on my ATM card?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The maximum limits<sup>11</sup> shared for both local and overseas withdrawals are:<br> </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>HSBC Premier Card                      HKD80,000<br> </li> 
 <li>Other personal customer cards    HKD80,000</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Withdrawing the maximum amount may require a few transactions, depending on the dispensing limit of the ATM.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To strengthen security controls for ATM services, the overseas ATM daily withdrawal limit (including cash advances) for all ATM and credit cards was pre-set to HKD0. If you have not yet set the ATM withdrawal limit, please do so for your credit card(s) or ATM card(s) through Personal Internet Banking, phone banking, HSBC Mobile Banking, any HSBC branch or any HSBC/Hang Seng ATM in Hong Kong.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><sup>11</sup>If you wish to withdraw the maximum amount, you may have to do so more than once, depending on the dispensing limit per transaction of the ATM used.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is the daily transfer limit for my ATM card? How can I activate the overseas ATM daily transfer limit?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The daily transfer limit refers to the maximum amount you can transfer to HSBC accounts that are NOT linked to customers' ATM/credit cards or Hang Seng accounts from HSBC or Hang Seng ATMs in Hong Kong.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To find your daily transfer limit, log on to Personal Internet Banking and go to My HSBC then to Maintain My Details. You can check your ATM transfer limit under View and Set Transaction Limit.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To strengthen security controls for ATM services, the overseas ATM daily transfer limit was pre-set to HKD0. If you have not yet set the ATM transfer limit, you can activate via Personal Internet Banking and our branches in Hong Kong.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I activate the 'Overseas ATM Daily Withdrawal Limit' (including cash advance) and 'Overseas ATM Daily Transfer Limit'?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For your security, the overseas daily withdrawal limit and overseas transfer limit for all ATM and credit cards is HKD0.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can set a new overseas withdrawal limit through:<br> </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Personal Internet Banking</li> 
 <li>Phone banking</li> 
 <li>Mobile Banking</li> 
 <li>HSBC branch in Hong Kong</li> 
 <li>HSBC or Hang Seng ATMs in Hong Kong</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To set a new overseas transfer limit log on to Personal Internet Banking or visit a HSBC branch in Hong Kong.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is the maximum ATM daily withdrawal limit for the HSBC Premier Junior Pack Cash Card or Cash Card Beneficiary Card? How can I activate the overseas ATM daily withdrawal limit?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The maximum ATM daily withdrawal limits shared with both local and overseas withdrawals are as follows:</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-NTCTBL-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div class="table-wrapper c-999" data-accessibility-tick-icon-text="available" data-accessibility-cross-icon-text="not available" id="content_main_notice_table_5">
     <table width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" border="1">
<tbody><tr><td valign="top">HSBC Premier Junior Pack Cash Card <br>
</td>
<td valign="top" style="text-align: center;">HKD80,000<br>
</td>
</tr><tr><td valign="top">Cash Card Beneficiary Card  <br>
</td>
<td valign="top" style="text-align: center;">HKD80,000</td>
</tr></tbody></table>

</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_33" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Withdrawing the maximum amount may require a few transactions, depending on the dispensing limit of the ATM.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can activate overseas withdrawals on behalf of your child or family member by visiting a HSBC branch in Hong Kong. HSBC Premier customers can also activate withdrawals by phone banking.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The family member who holds the card can also activate overseas withdrawals themselves at a HSBC or Hang Seng ATM in Hong Kong.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How long does it take to activate overseas ATM withdrawals? Can I activate more than one card at a time?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To activate overseas withdrawals for multiple cards, you can select All cards at HSBC or Hang Seng ATMs in Hong Kong - this takes two working days to process.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Or if you're using Personal Internet Banking or mobile banking you can select multiple cards for activation - this will be processed instantly.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you've registered your mobile phone number with us we'll confirm the activation by SMS text message. You can also check whether your request was processed via ATM, Personal Internet Banking, mobile banking or phone banking.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Reminder note: If you wish to withdraw the maximum amount, you may have to do so more than once, depending on the dispensing limit per transaction of the ATM used.</p>

</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>

</div>

            Charity Donations
    </h2>
    <div class="row">

<h3 class="heading A-TYP16R-RW-ALL " id="content_main_heading_4">
    <strong>How can I tell which charities support the eReceipt service?</strong>
</h3>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_34" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Charities that support the eReceipt service are marked with a special indicator on the charity donation list. Please note that in order to use the eReceipt service you can only make a donation by bank account transfer, not by credit card.<br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_4" class="accordions-container sm-12">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_10" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="1514343868__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="1514343868__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other Charity donations FAQs </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="1514343868__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_14">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_15" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_35" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can my charity donation eReceipt be used for tax reduction purposes?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, it is officially accepted proof for tax purposes. The eReceipt is retained for up to 24 months for your reference. You can save it or print for your records.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If I do not provide the name of the donor can I request a charity donation eReceipt?<br>
</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No, you must provide the donor's name if you request a donation eReceipt. The donor's name is essential if the receipt is to be used for tax purposes.<br>
</p>

</div></div>

<h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL text-container text ">
    
    
        
        Notes
    
</h2>

</div>
